name: Cake Painting Workshop
description: Join this unique Cake Painting Workshop at Eywa Café. Learn how to turn your cake into a beautiful canvas using edible buttercream paints. Whether you’re a beginner or a baking enthusiast, this hands-on session promises fun, flavour, and artistry, with a cake you can proudly take home

name: Retro Gaming console workshop
description:
👾 Gamers + Makers, this is for you!
What if you could design, solder, and build your own handheld gaming console – and then power it up to play Super Mario, Pokémon, Contra, and other NES classics?

At the DIY Retro Gaming Console Workshop, we’re combining electronics, creativity, and nostalgia into one unforgettable experience.

You will learn:
• Designing & debugging electronic circuits
• PCB fabrication basics
• Soldering & assembling components
• Using tools with hands-on guidance
• Mentorship from passionate makers

🎮 And the best part?
You’ll walk away with a fully functional retro gaming console that runs Nintendo classics!

Limited seats! Secure your spot today

name: Heart Lamp Interactive Workshop | Freedom, Stories, Art & Reflection
description:
Some books stay with you long after you’ve turned the last page. Heart Lamp, the International Booker Prize–winning anthology by Banu Mushtaq, is one of those rare works. It makes you think and it makes you feel—drawing you into the lived experiences of Indian Muslim women, while also inviting you to reflect on your own world.
This October, we’re bringing Heart Lamp off the page and into our lives with an interactive workshop on the idea of freedom at our Indiranagar store. 
But this isn’t your usual book discussion. Instead, we’ll explore three of the anthology’s most powerful stories through music, art, and storytelling. It’s a chance to step away from screens, share perspectives, and spend a Sunday morning in meaningful conversation with fellow readers. No prior prep is needed—just pick up your copy of Heart Lamp at Champaca before the workshop.

name: Chai Time - Japan Style
description:
Chai Time – Japan Style 🌿🍵✨
Not your usual chai break 👀
Here, you whisk your own matcha, sip it slow, and vibe with chewy-soft mochi that’s almost too cute to eat. 🌸
Write your secret wishes on our dreamy Japanese Wishing Tree (manifest + aesthetic ✨) and let the calm, soulful vibes take over.
It’s chai time… but with a Japanese twist. Calm, fun & totally Instagrammable 💚

name: Maestro Impro™️ by Improv Lore
description:
Maestro Impro™️ is a beloved world-famous competitive elimination-style improv format that pits twelve brave improvisers against each other. They’ll take on scenes, games, and challenges from the audience to build never-before seen/heard stories.

After each round, the audience gets to vote improvisers out until just one remains to claim all the improv glory and be crowned the Maestro for the month!
Who are Improv Lore?

We are Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, works towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.

name: PowerPoint Roulette by Improv Lore
description:
PowerPoint Roulette is a fast-paced, creative show where improvisers deliver presentations from slides they’ve never seen before. Each performer is faced with slides filled with bizarre graphs, meaningless acronyms, and unexpected themes. With no time to prepare, they must improvise convincing explanations, facts, stories, and insights on the spot.

Serious business pitches, heartfelt eulogies, hard-hitting TED talks, and fanciful conspiracy theories - prepare yourselves for a night ‘official’ fun! The audience gets to join the revelry by asking questions, creating a truly unpredictable night of improvised theatrics.

Who are Improv Lore?

We are a Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, working towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.

name: The Art Of Flight
description:
In this 90-minute deep dive into arm balances, we’ll move beyond the surface and into the strength, structure, and spirit of the poses that make us feel like we're flying.

We’ll begin by warming up the body with targeted strength and mobility drills to activate the core, wrists, and shoulders. This lays the foundation for safe and sustainable arm balancing.
From there, we’ll explore essential alignment principles that demystify key transitions and make these seemingly impossible shapes, more accessible.
Through clear breakdowns and playful experimentation, you’ll learn how to “take off” with confidence—whether you’re working on Crow, Side Crow, Hustler’s or Peacock pose.
We’ll also cover how to fall safely, so fear doesn’t hold you back, and give space for mindful repetition, skill refinement, and personal breakthroughs.
Expect a blend of technique, mindset coaching, and drills, all aimed at helping you tap into your inner strength and elevate your practice.

Whether you're just starting to hover or need refining in arm balances; this is a safe space for you to practice and learn.

name: NOT-SO-KLASSIC (Veg)
description:
At Klaa, we’re always celebrating the roots but sometimes, we like to bend the rules.
Not So Klassic is our playful new series where we reimagine Goan flavours through a different lens: layered, experimental, and just a little bit cheeky.

Think familiar ingredients doing unfamiliar things, flavours that surprise you, and plates that tell a new kind of story. Each menu is a limited-edition tasting experience paired with thoughtfully chosen wines to match the mood.

This isn’t your typical Goan thali.
It’s Not So Klassic and we hope you’re as excited to taste it as we are to cook it.

name: NOT-SO-KLASSIC (Non-veg)
description:
At Klaa, we’re always celebrating the roots but sometimes, we like to bend the rules.
Not So Klassic is our playful new series where we reimagine Goan flavours through a different lens: layered, experimental, and just a little bit cheeky.

Think familiar ingredients doing unfamiliar things, flavours that surprise you, and plates that tell a new kind of story. Each menu is a limited-edition tasting experience paired with thoughtfully chosen wines to match the mood.

This isn’t your typical Goan thali.
It’s Not So Klassic and we hope you’re as excited to taste it as we are to cook it.

name: Pint of View (Lecture 5): Fly Me To The Moon
description:
Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where classroom-styled lectures meet craft cocktails in pubs and bars.

In our fifth lecture, we’re bringing you Jatan Mehta, a space writer, journalist and author of Moon Monday, the world’s only blog & newsletter dedicated to covering lunar exploration by countries worldwide. He also writes Indian Space Progress, a monthly report on our country’s increasingly relevant space capabilities in the global arena.

Jatan will take us on a journey through humankind’s fascination with our closest celestial neighbour, the Moon. At long last, we are returning humans to the moon! China is aiming to land people on our cosmic companion by 2030, and the US wants to beat them. India is preparing to bring lunar samples. But why has it taken so long to get back to our moon? What sets it apart from Mars and the rest of the Solar System? Come, join us to get answers to these key questions at our lecture: Fly Me To The Moon (From Apollo to Chandrayaan: A Dive into the History & Future of Lunar Exploration).

All of this, over Geist beer on tap at Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar! 🍻

What to Expect:

• A 60-minute lecture on the history and future of lunar exploration
• 15–20 minutes of interactive Q&A
• One Geist beer on tap or a mocktail included with your ticket
• A lively mixer to share your insights and learnings and take home a new perspective

Event Details:

📅 Sunday, 28th September | 4 PM – 6 PM
📍 Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar
🎫 Limited to 60 attendees only

About the Lecturer

Jatan Mehta is a globally published space writer and journalist. He authors Moon Monday, the world’s only blog & newsletter dedicated to covering lunar exploration by countries worldwide. Jatan also writes Indian Space Progress, a monthly report on our country’s increasingly relevant space capabilities in the global arena. His space blog can be found at https://jatan.space

About Pint of View

Inspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., Pint of View brings this format to India for the first time. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand, walking out with a new way of seeing the world.

Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

name: Silent Reading
description: Too busy to read lately? Here’s your pause button. Step away from the rush and gift yourself two quiet hours with a book and a warm cup of coffee. No deadlines, no distractions - just you, the pages, and a little peace. Bring along your own read or pick one from our shelves and let yourself sink into the story you’ve been meaning to get back to.

name: Sisters & Misters Salsa Workshop
description:
Salsa – Beginner Workshop

Always wanted to try Salsa but didn’t know where to start? This workshop is the perfect first step!

Join us for a fun session for beginners - no prior dance experience required.

We’ll guide you through the basics in a relaxed, playful way so you can feel the music, move with confidence, and discover just how fun and easy Salsa really is.

What to Expect:
1. Easy-to-follow salsa steps 
2. Partner rotations so you meet & dance with everyone
3. Interactive games to learn rhythm & movement

Perfect for:
    •    Total beginners (no dance background needed)
    •    Anyone looking to try something new & exciting
    •    People who love music, movement, and good vibes!

Dress code:

1. Wear whatever makes you feel your best and most comfortable - should be easy for you to move around. 
2. ⁠Carry a pair of socks with you - it’ll help with the dancing. You won’t be needing any special footwear for the session.

name: Desi Breakfast Club
description:
From the deep, masala-laden bite of Bedmi Poori to the indulgent fluff of Chole Bhature, every plate is a page from a desi breakfast diary.

Craving something richer? Keema Pav brings the heat. And the Parathas? Stuffed, griddled, and made exactly the way they should be — with love, ghee, and no shortcuts.

This isn’t a meal. It’s a morning well spent.

Now Serving Desi Breakfast only at Treat.
Every Sunday 09:30 am - 11:30 am

PLEASE NOTE: We have two time slots available for the Desi Breakfast Club:

Slot 1 - 09:30 AM - 10:15 AM
Slot 2 - 10:30 AM - 11:15 AM

- Once you send in your reservation request, our team will get in touch to confirm your preferred timing. If your chosen slot is full, we’ll happily offer you the next available one.

- To reserve your spot, we’re charging a small fee of ₹200 per person—which is fully redeemable against your meal. You’re free to choose anything from the menu, and if your bill goes over, you can simply settle the difference at the restaurant.

Can’t wait to see you at the Desi Breakfast Club ☀️

name: Penciljam at Nrityagram
description: 📆 28 Sept 2025 ⏱ 11:00 am - 1:00 pm 📍 Nrityagram Founded in 1990 by visionary Odissi dancer Protima Gauri, Nrityagram stands as India’s first modern dance village—a Gurukula-inspired residential community where artists live, train, and create within an immersive, purpose-built campus. You don’t need artistic skill to participate in this event – just boundless curiosity and a love for drawing. Visit the link in bio for details about this event, rules, group transport and other travel options.👇 #sketching #community #bangalore #bengaluru #urbansketchers #Outdoordrawing #penciljam #drawingbengaluru #penciljammers #bengaluruweekends #penciljambengaluru #slowgatherings @nrityagram

name: Chess Connect - Rapid
description: Experience a full day of competitive and engaging chess at 'Chess Connect - Rapid,' hosted by the Bangalore Chess Club. This event is a rapid-format chess meetup and tournament open to players of all skill levels who are looking to test their abilities and connect with the local chess community. The tournament follows a 10+5 time control format, providing five hours of thrilling rapid chess. The day is structured with a detailed schedule, starting with registration and a player briefing at 10:00 AM, followed by the first round at 10:20 AM. The tournament continues with seven rounds throughout the day, including a scheduled lunch break. Beyond the competition, there are numerous incentives for participants. Prizes will be awarded to the top three players, and all attendees are eligible for lucky-draw prizes, which include premium chess sets and coveted Chess.com Diamond memberships. A unique feature of this event is the opportunity to play on an AI-powered GoChess Smart Board, offering a futuristic chess experience. Please note the terms and conditions: tickets are non-refundable, and participants should arrive 15 minutes early for check-in. By attending, you consent to photography and media coverage by the organizers.

name: Artisanal Perfume Making
description: Discover the enchanting art of artisanal perfumery in this hands-on workshop designed to awaken your senses and unleash your creativity. Held at the elegant Hyatt Centric in Hebbal, this experience offers a unique opportunity to step into the shoes of a perfumer and craft a scent that is uniquely yours. Guided by Kareem, a passionate host with a deep understanding of fragrance composition, you will explore the foundational principles of scent creation. The session begins with an introduction to the different fragrance families, notes, and the delicate balance required to build a harmonious perfume. You will then have access to a curated selection of high-quality perfume oils and ingredients, allowing you to experiment with various combinations to find your perfect blend. The highlight of the workshop is the creation of your own 30ml bottle of signature Eau de Parfum, which you will take home as a lasting memento of your olfactory journey. All necessary materials, including the perfume oils, beaker, and the final bottle, are provided. This immersive and educational experience is perfect for anyone curious about the world of fragrances, offering a personalized and memorable way to engage with the timeless craft of perfume making. No prior experience is necessary, only a desire to explore and create.

name: A Gnocchi Making Experience
description: Journey to the heart of Italian cuisine with this authentic gnocchi making experience at Italia, located in The Park Bangalore. Gnocchi, the beloved Italian dumplings, have a rich history dating back to the Roman Empire, and this workshop invites you to master the art of creating these soft, pillowy delights from scratch. Under the guidance of an expert chef, you will learn the traditional techniques passed down through generations. The hands-on session covers every step of the process, from selecting the right potatoes to achieving the perfect dough consistency, rolling, and shaping the dumplings. You will discover the secrets to making light and airy gnocchi that melt in your mouth. The experience includes learning to prepare two classic sauces to accompany your freshly made gnocchi, allowing you to create a complete and satisfying Italian meal. This immersive cook-along is more than just a cooking class; it's a celebration of culinary heritage and the joy of creating food with your own hands. All ingredients and equipment are provided, and you will leave with a recipe card and the confidence to recreate this classic dish at home. It's a perfect activity for food enthusiasts, aspiring chefs, and anyone looking to connect with the soulful traditions of Italian cooking.

name: KhoslaRaghu concert
description: Delhi-based duo KhoslaRaghu—Sanchit and Rishabh—bring their signature blend of Indian melodies and modern beats to Bangalore for the very first time. Catch them live at Koramangala Social on December 19, where they’ll perform tracks from their EP Aao Bhula Dein alongside fresh new sounds, promising a night that fuses soulful music with infectious energy.

location.name: Fandom at Gilly's Redefined, Koramangala

name: Annual Flea Market for Cycling Community
description: 🚲 SAVE THE DATE 🚲 Our Annual Flea Market is back! 📅 September 28th, 2025 Join us for another year of amazing finds, great deals, and cycling community vibes at Crankmeister Bicycles. Call us to book yourself a table and to let us know that you will be coming. There will be yummy treats baked by @yin.n.yum, apart from coffee, @umamibrew kombucha and obviously a lot of great deals on cycles and accessories. Whatsapp us on 8105526519 to book your slots. #FleaMarket #Bangalore #CyclingCommunity #SaveTheDate #cycling

name: Where Jazz Meets Soul
description: Where jazz meets soul, and groove meets flow. This week at The Middle Room, Rajkanwar Sodhi aka Raj brings his new EP Weather Changes Moods , a journey through house, soul, jazz, funk, and disco. With 15M+ streams and sets at India’s biggest festivals, Raj’s live show fuses guitar, sampling, and groove into soundscapes that are equal parts meditative and rhythmic. An intimate night of music, mood, and movement awaits. 🗓 Sunday, 28th September 🕘 9:30 PM onwards 📍 Middle Room, Bangalore Tickets exclusively on Swiggy Scenes. Book your seats through the link in bio.

name: K-Fiesta at Opera House
description: Step into the heart of Korean Culture with fun cultural activities, performances, games and more, to celebrate the 7th Anniversary of Opera House. Visit Samsung Opera House, Bengaluru on 28th September, 12 PM onwards. ENTRY IS FREE. Registration link in bio. #BENGALURUKWAVEFANCLUB #kfiestaatsoh #soh7thanniversary #KPOPININDIA #KPOPINDIA #BENGALURUKPOPPERS #BENGALURU #BKFEVENTS2025 #BKFEVENTS #KPOPFANSININDIA #KCULTURE #KDRAMA #KPOP #KOREANCULTURE

name: Heritage Walk - Whitefield
description: Step back into the early days of Whitefield with this guided heritage walk on September 28 at 9 AM. Led by Bengaluru Prayana and Bengaluritage, the walk traces the footsteps of the original settlers—uncovering stories of a quaint village long before it became the heart of the IT boom. With history, anecdotes, and breakfast included, it’s a rare chance to rediscover the city’s layered past.

name: An Exploration of Romantic Miniatures
description: The Blue Room welcomes pianist Natallia Kapylova for an intimate evening of Romantic-era piano miniatures, each piece unfolding like a private conversation with composers from Johann to Astor. With her thoughtful artistry, Natallia invites listeners into a world where music becomes storytelling—sometimes tender, sometimes stormy, always deeply human. Catch this solo recital on September 28 at 7 PM.

name: Friends of the Farmer
description: Maverick & Farmer’s much-loved Friends of the Farmer series returns on September 28, 4–6 PM, spotlighting two remarkable estates—Moolah Manay, with its rare Excelsa beans yeast-fermented for 84 hours, and Poomale Estate from Coorg, where permaculture and biodiversity shape every sip. Guided by QC Manager Pannaga Karumbaiah, the tasting will feature vibrant coffees paired with brews from three home brewers curated by Arpan Ramtek, promising a deep dive into terroir, technique, and flavor.

location.name: South United Football Club, Ulsoor
location.address: South United Football Club, Ulsoor, Bangalore

name: Sneaker Art Workshop
description: Spots are limited! Secure yours today by contacting us now! Unleash your creativity and design your own sneakers at our Sneaker Art Workshop, happening at Mixnosh Café in Sector 2, HSR Layout (postal code 560102) on 27th July, starting at 10 AM onwards (cheekysneeky.com) In the workshop, participants will explore the full process of creating custom sneaker art. First, you’ll Design Your Vision by choosing your colors, patterns, and style to develop a unique concept (cheekysneeky.com). Next, you’ll move on to Stencil & Sketch, using stencils and markers to outline your design on your sneakers (cheekysneeky.com). Then comes the fun part: Paint & Personalize, where you bring your design to life using vibrant paints and creative techniques (cheekysneeky.com). Finally, you will Seal & Maintain your artwork, learning best practices to protect and care for your custom sneaker art (cheekysneeky.com). All materials are provided, and you’re also welcome to bring your own sneakers and creativity to personalize (cheekysneeky.com). Whether you’re a seasoned artist or just looking for a fun, expressive project, this workshop invites you to transform your sneakers into wearable artworks in a relaxed café setting. This immersive, hands-on experience provides everything you need—from guidance to supplies—to fully express your personal style through sneaker art.
